intro: Sideroxylon rufotomentosum, commonly known as the red-tomentose ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its dense, hard wood and its hairy, reddish-brown bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is adapted to grow in dry, well-drained soils.
